type: Renovation or replacement of a bridge
short_summary: Recall a template plans and prepare a tender evaluation package for the replacement of the Bristy Cove bridge.
description: This tender contains detailed descriptions of requirements, proposed timeline, and other information necessary for bidders to develop their solutions
full_summary:
### EA003-250222 - Request for Proposal: Bristy Cove Bridge Rehabilitation

**Publication Dates**

* [Publication Date: 2024-06-07](https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/fra/)
* Appel de proposition fermé le [Tender Closing Date: 2024-06-24T14:00:00](https://www.tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca/fra/)

### Background

Following a previous contract and additional investigation work, the loading rating of the Bristy Cove Bridge has been reduced to 12 tonnes. This will impact various stakeholders who utilize the bridge during the tourism season. Therefore, the Department of Public Works and Government Services, as the contracting entity, intends to engage a design consultant to prepare a tender package for the replacement of the existing bridge.

The proposed project aims to replace the existing superstructure with a prefabricated panel bridge before the next winter season. Consequently, the tender package must be completed by early September.

### Scope and Objectives

The scope of this Request for Proposal (RFP) is to engage a professional team to prepare a tender package for the replacement of the Bristy Cove Bridge. The objectives of this proposal are to:

* Identify a qualified team to prepare a detailed tender package for the replacement of the existing bridge;
* Ensure that the tender package complies with the applicable regulations, laws, and standards;
* Facilitate a smooth and efficient tendering process.

### Evaluation Criteria

Responses will be evaluated based on a combination of technical merit and price, with the highest combined rating being the most highly preferred.

### Pre-Qualified Firms

The following firms have been pre-qualified for this proposal:

1. Hilcon Ltd.
2. CIMA+
3. COWI North America Ltd.
4. R.V. Anderson Associates Ltd.
5. Stantec Consulting
6. CBCL Ltd.

All qualified firms will receive an invitation to participate in the proposal process.

### Points of Contact

For further information, please contact [Carlos Castillo Nieto](mailto:Carlos.CastilloNieto@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) or visit the Commissionaires' website.

### Languages of Communication

The official languages of communication for this proposal are English and French.

According to the procurement category, trade agreements, and regions of delivery, this proposal will be evaluated based on specific criteria. To learn more about the proposal and evaluation process, download the attached Request for Proposal document.

Note:
